messages.title: HEIDI ALLEN IN CONVERSATION
messages.content: Heidi Allen talks about her background in manufacturing and astrophysics, her values, work ethos, and why she became a Conservative member. She emphasizes the importance of hard work and resolving problems at their root.

messages.title: HILLS ROAD PLANS HALF-BAKED
messages.content: Local campaigners express concerns over segregated cycle plans on Hills Road, citing excessive costs and safety issues for pedestrians.

messages.title: THANK YOU QUEEN EDITH'S!
messages.content: Acknowledgement of the improved results for the Conservatives in recent City Council elections and a thank you to voters.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Criticism of the Hills Road segregated cycle plans, discussing the high costs and the safety impact on pedestrians.

mentions.tacticalSituation: References the improved Conservative vote share in Queen Edith's ward, suggesting tactical voting could lead to a Conservative victory.

housing.content: Concern expressed over expensive plans for segregated cycle schemes on Hills Road and their impact on parking spaces and pedestrian safety.

leaflet.personalStatement: Heidi Allen speaks about her commitment to hard work, determination to solve problems at their root, and her belief in enterprise and effort.

images.caption: Heidi Allen and Andy Bower at a council meeting.
